main_page.title: Bringing a partner or family
main_page.summary: The page provides guidance on how individuals in Australia can bring their partner or family either temporarily or permanently, depending on their immigration status. It outlines steps and considerations for Australian citizens, visa holders, returning Australians, and New Zealand citizens. It also links to relevant visa information and options.

steps: Identify if the family visit or stay will be temporary or permanent.
Find the appropriate visa based on the family member's intention.
Identify if the family visit or stay will be temporary or permanent.
Check if the visa allows subsequent entrants and if family members were previously declared.
If subsequent entrants are not allowed, the family must apply for a visa based on their intention.
notes: Includes reference to a list of all visas that allow subsequent entrants.

steps: Apply for Australian citizenship by descent for children to obtain an Australian passport.
Partner or other family members will need a visa.
Identify and apply for the correct visa based on the family member’s intention.

new_zealand_citizens.guidance: Directed to information specifically for New Zealand citizens bringing family.

child_pages.title: Bringing a partner or family
child_pages.summary: This page provides guidance for individuals who want to bring a partner or family member to Australia, whether temporarily or permanently. It outlines the different pathways depending on whether the requester is an Australian citizen, permanent resident, visa holder, returning Australian, or New Zealand citizen.

steps: Identify whether the family member intends to come temporarily or permanently
Find the appropriate visa based on the family member's intention
Identify whether the family member intends to come temporarily or permanently
Check if the current visa allows subsequent entrants and that family members were previously declared
If subsequent entrants are not allowed, the family member must apply for a visa based on their intention
Apply for Australian citizenship by descent for overseas-born children before they can obtain an Australian passport; otherwise, they need a visa
Partner or other family members require a visa
Find the right visa based on their intention

new_zealand_citizens.information: Options available under 'New Zealand citizens – your family'

child_pages.title: Bringing a partner or family
child_pages.summary: This page provides guidance for people who want to bring their partner or family members to Australia, either temporarily or permanently. Instructions vary depending on whether the person inviting family is an Australian citizen, permanent resident, visa holder, returning Australian, or New Zealand citizen. The page outlines the steps each group should follow and refers users to relevant visa options.

steps: Identify whether the family member will come temporarily or permanently.
Find the appropriate visa based on their intention.
Identify whether the family member will come temporarily or permanently.
Check whether your visa allows subsequent entrants and whether you have declared family members.
If your visa does not allow subsequent entrants, they must apply for a visa based on their intention.
Apply for Australian citizenship by descent for overseas‑born children before seeking a passport.
Partners or other family members will need a visa.
Find the appropriate visa based on their intention.
Review available options in the 'New Zealand citizens – your family' section.

key_concepts.temporary_vs_permanent: Most steps begin with determining whether the family member is coming temporarily or permanently.
key_concepts.subsequent_entrant_requirement: Visa holders must check whether their visa allows subsequent entrants and whether family members were previously declared.

page_metadata.title: Bringing a partner or family
page_metadata.purpose: Guidance for bringing a partner or family member to Australia, either temporarily or permanently, depending on the inviter’s immigration status.

key_concepts.temporary_vs_permanent: First determine whether family members intend to come temporarily or permanently.
key_concepts.subsequent_entrants: Visa holders must check if their visa allows subsequent entrants and ensure family members were previously declared.

australian_citizens_or_permanent_residen.description: People who are Australian citizens or permanent residents inviting family.
steps: Identify whether the family member intends to come temporarily or permanently.
Find the appropriate visa based on the family member’s intention.

visa_holders.description: Individuals currently holding an Australian visa who want their family to join them.
steps: Identify whether the family member intends to come temporarily or permanently.
Check whether the current visa allows subsequent entrants and whether family members were previously declared.
If the visa does not allow subsequent entrants, the family member must apply for a visa based on their intention.
notes: Some visas allow subsequent entrants; refer to the list of eligible visas.

returning_australians_with_overseas_born.description: Australian citizens or permanent residents returning to Australia with family born overseas.
steps: Apply for Australian citizenship by descent for overseas-born children before applying for an Australian passport; otherwise, they must obtain a visa.
Partners or other family members require a visa.
Identify and apply for the appropriate visa based on the family member’s intention.

new_zealand_citizens.description: New Zealand citizens seeking to bring family to Australia.
new_zealand_citizens.guidance: Review options under the 'New Zealand citizens – your family' section.
steps: Review available family options tailored for New Zealand citizens (if applicable).
